comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Presumably the wife of author and explorer Russell Hastings Millward Also at

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: I haven't found who she was yet, but did run into a piece about a fiancee of Russell H Millward who married someone else in 1913 See middle column (with photo of his former fiancee) of The evening world., June 25, 1913, Final Extra, Image 2 chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn83030193/1913-06-25/ed-...

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: The Washington times., August 29, 1915, SUNDAY EVENING EDITION, Page 6 chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn84026749/1915-08-29/ed-... does reveal that the lady in this photo is the former Miss Edna Boyden of Boston. The photo in the newspaper (credited to Harris & Ewing) is also in a hat with flowers like this, but the cropping makes it impossible to tell if it is the same hat.

comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Such big eyes she had! His fraternity newsletter, The Sigma Chi quarterly, confirms that Russell Millward married Miss Edna Boyden at Boston on 27 August 1914. books.google.com/books?id=_A8TAAAAIAAJ&pg=PA164&l...
